clinical_study.brief_title: Ipragliflozin Add-on Long-term Study in Japanese Participants With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus on Sitagliptin (MK-0431J-849)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicenter, Open-label Long-term Treatment Trial to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Addition of Ipragliflozin in Japanese Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Who Have Inadequate Glycemic Control on Sitagliptin Monotherapy in Addition to Diet and Exercise Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study to assess the safety and efficacy of the addition of ipragliflozin to sitagliptin in Japanese participants with Type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) who have inadequate glycemic control on sitagliptin, diet, and exercise therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who experienced at least one adverse event (AE)
Percentage of participants who discontinued from the study drug due to an AE

arm_group.description: Ipragliflozin once daily for 52 weeks with sitagliptin, diet, and exercise.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has Type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Has inadequate glycemic control on diet/exercise therapy and sitagliptin monotherapy
- Hemoglobin A1C (HbA1c) ≥7.0% and ≤10.0% before study participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of type 1 diabetes mellitus or a history of ketoacidosis
- History of any of the following medications: Thiazolidinediones (TZD) and/or insulin within 12 weeks prior to study participation, sodium glucose cotransporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitors anytime
- Currently has a urinary tract infection or genital infection with subjective symptom
